Welcome

Eli’s Table features a menu offering bold, worldly flavors while using fresh and local ingredients. Named after the owner of Charleston Hospitality Group’s son Eli, the restaurant is sentimental for many reasons. With the flair our Executive Chef has brought to Eli’s Table, guests are treated with a new way to savor their favorite classics. Tantalize your taste buds and join us at Eli’s Table tonight.
HOURS 
Wednesday through Sunday: 5 – 11 PM

Monday, Tuesday: Closed

Dinner menu await you to be discovered.
Our Menu 
Brunch and Dinner menus await you to be discovered.
Our Menu 
Book Your Event

Eli’s Table will make your special days unforgettable with its extensive menu options.Book your event now.

READ MORE 
If you aren’t stopping here, you are missing out. Eli’s Table is one of the best places for breakfast. I can’t get beyond the sweet potato pancackes, but I have tasted some of my husband’s choices. The drinks are amazing…and the service is top-notch. We hadn’t been back in a year, and got the same waitress at the same table…enjoy.
Saundra ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ 
Eli’s Table is a Hidden Treasure on Meeting Street! We found Eli’s Table after a long morning of walking The Battery, the park, and everything in between. It is a delightful surprise in the middle of everything! We enjoyed a late lunch complete with a delicious mimosa that another customer highly recommended as she overheard our indecision. Her advice was spot on! The service was extraordinary and our lunch was excellent. Our only regret is that we did not get to return for dinner or brunch before we had to leave. WE WILL RETURN TO CHARLESTON AND ELI’S!
Nane LaGrange ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ 
One of the best restaurants in Charleston! The egg croissant was one of the best I’ve had. Danny was an awesome server/bartender and made sure our table was happy well taken care of. Beautiful patio and great ambiance! Definitely will be back soon and highly recommend.
Leah L. ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ 
Had a great time. Ray and Kris took excellent care of us. Next best thing to being at a restaurant in New Orleans.
Marcelle S. ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ 
We’ve been to Eli’s Table twice before. This time we took our two kids which are 4 and 2 which anyone with children knows that can be difficult sometimes, but we were sitting fast and our waiter Danny was amazing. Our food was great as always; we had chicken and waffles, and Eli’s breakfast and a short stack of pancakes. All the food was delicious and the service was very good. Eli’s is and will always be a staple for our family when we visit the Holy City.
Dylan Short ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
